Name: Statuette of Isis and Horus
Description: Statuette of the goddess Isis seated on a throne suckling her son Horus. Horus has the uraeus on his forehead. Isis is guiding her left breast towards Horus with her right hand. She also has a uraeus as well as a crown with a cobra frieze from which used to rise her lyre-shaped horns, now broken.
